intro: Erythroxylum obtusum, commonly known as the bluntleaf coca, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in high-altitude environments, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves with a leathery texture and a distinctive blunt shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in terminal panicles, and are typically white or pale pink in color. Erythroxylum obtusum is part of the Erythroxylaceae family and is closely related to the genus that includes the coca plant, Erythroxylum coca.
